alert.note: Alert for Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:05AM CDT until May 05 at 9:51PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Little River near Tecumseh affecting Seminole and Pottawatomie Counties.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC125-133-060115- /O.CON.KOUN.FL.W.0003.000000T0000Z-220506T0251Z/ /TCMO2.1.ER.220505T0305Z.220505T0530Z.220505T2051Z.NO/ 805 AM CDT Thu May 5 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little River near Tecumseh. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding to depths of 3 feet occurs over croplands... pastures... and rural roads along the river. The area affected is entirely rural... and downstream of Lake Thunderbird... from near Macomb in Pottawatomie County to near Bowlegs in western Seminole County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 14.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM CDT Thursday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The Little River is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 4.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
